document_data.caption: A map showing the River Tir in central Rashemen.
document_data.name: River Tir
document_data.mainbody: The '''River Tir''' was a river in [[Rashemen]] that served as a crucial trading route for the [[Rashemaar]] people.{{Template:Cite book/Unapproachable East|129}}
document_data.Description: Like the great [[River Rasha]], the Tir was a long and broad-bodied waterway that vital for transportation and the facilitation of commerce in Rashemen. The flow of the river picked up tempo and became more rapid as it neared the town of [[Taporan]].
document_data.Geography: The River Tir originated in the [[High Country (Rashemen)|High Country]] mountain range in eastern Rashemen and went southwest until it joined with the [[River Rasha]] and emptied into [[Lake Tirulag]].
document_data.Notable Locations: * [[Taporan]], a small fishing town whose residents were expert boatmen.
